plptool

Class PLPSimBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • plptool.PLPSimBus

  • public class PLPSimBus
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the simulation core bus / front-side bus. Simulator users can attach I/O module classes that extend the PLPSimBusModule abstract class. This object is ideally used by the simulation core during memory access. For example, the PLPTool MIPS simulation core attaches its memory module to the bus, and performs bus write and read during the MEM stage of the pipeline. All modules attached to the bus can be accessed through this class' methods, or directly using the getModRef function.
    See Also:
    PLPSimCore, plpmips.PLPMIPSSim, PLPSimBusModule, MemModule, getModRef(int)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PLPSimBus()
      The default constructor for the class will start with a bus with nothing attached to it.
      PLPSimBus(MemModule mem)
      This constructor will attach the provided memory module to the bus.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PLPSimBus

        public PLPSimBus()
        The default constructor for the class will start with a bus with nothing attached to it. This may be preferable for CPUs that do not use this bus to write to main memory.
        See Also:
        PLPSimBus(PLPSimCore)

      • PLPSimBus

        public PLPSimBus(MemModule mem)
        This constructor will attach the provided memory module to the bus. Can be used with simulator cores with main memory attached to the bus.
        Parameters:
        PLPSimCore - The simulator core
        See Also:
        PLPSimBus()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public int add(PLPSimBusModule module)
        Attach a module to the bus.
        Parameters:
        module - PLPSimBusModule-based class to be added
        Returns:
        Index of the new added module, or -1 if error occurred

      • remove

        public int remove(int index)
        Remove a module specified by the index from this bus.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        Always returns PLP_OK

      • read

        public java.lang.Object read(long addr)
        Issue a read to the bus. This will return a value from specified address starting with the module with lowest index (main memory preferably). If there's any address space overlap, the module with lower index will be read, but all modules do get the read command.
        Parameters:
        addr - Address to read from
        Returns:
        Data with successful read, -1 otherwise

      • write

        public int write(long addr,
                 java.lang.Object data,
                 boolean isInstr)
        Issue a write to the bus. The write will be issued to all modules if there's an address overlap.
        Parameters:
        addr - Address to write to
        data - Data to write
        isInstr - Specify whether the data is instruction or not
        Returns:
        PLP_OK on successful operation, error code otherwise

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the specified address is valid and initialized

        Returns:

      • disableAllModules

        public int disableAllModules()
        Disable all I/O mods. Including the main memory if it is attached to the bus. Be careful.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 on completion.
